Sequence Information.Target Organism: Fungi:Alternaria brassicola (MIC=20 µg/ml), Ascochyta pisi (MIC=200 µg/ml), Botrytis cinerea (MIC=50 µg/ml), Cercospora beticola (MIC=10 µg/ml), Colletotrichum lindemuthianum (MIC=6 µg/ml), Fusarium culmorum (MIC=30 µg/ml), Fusarium oxysporum f.sp.pisi (MIC=15 µg/ml), Fusarium oxysporum f.sp.lycopersici (MIC=200 µg/ml), Nectria haematococca (MIC=15 µg/ml), Phoma betae (MIC=25 µg/ml), Pyrenophora tritici-repentis (MIC=300 µg/ml), Pyricularia oryzae (MIC=6 µg/ml), Rhizoctonia solani (MIC=60 µg/ml), Verticillium dahliae (MIC=12 µg/ml), Venturia inequalis (MIC=12 µg/ml).Gram-positive bacteria:Bacillus megaterium (MIC=6 µg/ml), Sarcina lutea (MIC=100 µg/ml).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Cytotoxicity: No cytotoxicity information found in the reference(s) presented
Sequence Information.N-terminal Modification: Pyroglutamyl modification (Cyclization of a N-terminal glutamine)
Sequence Information.Function: Possesses antifungal activity and is also active on two tested Gram-positive bacteria

Literature.Title: Isolation and characterization of a novel class of plant antimicrobial peptides from Mirabilis jalapa L. seeds.
Literature.Author: Cammue B.P.A, de Bolle M.F.C, Terras F.R.G, Proost P, van Damme J, Rees S.B, Vanderleyden J, Broekaert W.F.

Literature.Title: Cloning and characterization of two cDNA clones encoding seed-specific antimicrobial peptides from Mirabilis jalapa L.
Literature.Author: de Bolle M.F, Eggermont K, Duncan R.E, Osborn R.W, Terras F.R.G, Broekaert W.F.
